Exactly. It doesn't even need to be a configuration option. Simply a
method in the strict sanitizer. Someone can override the sanitizer If
they need to.

Em sexta-feira, 15 de julho de 2011,
bogdan<reply@reply.github.com>
escreveu:
> The benefit of strict sanitizing in test mode show itself when you have something more than CRUD and create models not only from forms but by assigning all attributes manually as well.
> Like create comment from email response and forget that `author_id` is protected from mass assingment.
>
>
> So, You propose to include some sort of list of attribute names withing strict sanitizer that are ok
> And include `id` attribute in that list by default. Did I get you right?
